intro: Bupleurum junceum var. affine, commonly known as slender valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has a fibrous root system. It is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils. The species is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
